content: I presume that you cannot use the passwords that are use on the phone? If you need passwords for PC, you will need to contact the email provider.
creator: davidsk

content: Please provide more information, such as error messages (in English). Thank you
creator: davidsk

content:
Why not just use the default threaded view of email. Simple, clear to see and the thread is all together. Although I would recommend the traditional table view of the mail list pane over the new table view as it somehow manages to flatten the threads into some sort of flat thing that is exceedingly difficult to in the user interface.

That image looks like Thunderbird version 2. While version 2 had message threading it did not really come into it's own until version 3.
creator: MattAuSupport

content: I presume this is an IMAP account. Try highlighting the account in folder pane, rightclick and click 'subscribe' to see if the folders are available.
creator: davidsk

content: If your account is IMAP, all of the messages would be there. Since they are missing, I infer that you use POP for email. In that case, all sent messages are on the lost laptop.
creator: davidsk
